intro: Gisekia miltus var. pedunculata, commonly known as the pedunculate gisekia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
